intro: Impatiens cyanantha, commonly known as the blue impatiens, is a herbaceous perennial native to tropical regions of Africa. It is characterized by its striking blue to violet flowers, which bloom in clusters along the stems. The plant features heart-shaped, glossy leaves that are typically dark green in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and partial to full shade, making it a popular choice for shaded garden beds. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its long blooming period, which can last several months during the growing season.
